titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: Ella, Jim & I motored to Low Fell, and there lunched with Colonel & M

Doyle. It was an agreeable meal, tolerable meats washed down with bad champagne, & an abundance of goodwill. Jim and the officers turned out to be old comrades. On our way home I left cards on Major Murray, & the Colonel of the Troops billeted in Chester–le–Street. Then I attended Evensong in the Cathedral. [symbol]
